title: 114_s1955
content: The Act titled "Alaska Native Veterans Land Allotment Equity Act" clarifies occupancy of Native allotments in national forests. The Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act is amended to address revocation and repeal of Native allotments, as well as applications for allotment approval. The Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act is amended to reopen and consider approved any application closed by the Department of the Interior in 1971, pursuant to the civil action Shields v. United States. SEC. 3. Open season for certain Alaska Native veterans for allotments. Section 41 of the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act is amended to allow eligible recipients to receive allotments of Federal land not exceeding 160 acres. Eligible recipients must file for an allotment within 3 years of the Secretary's regulations under the Alaska Native Veterans Land Allotment Equity Act. Allotments must be selected from vacant land owned by the United States, land relinquished by the State of Alaska, or land conveyed to a recipient. Native Corporations can voluntarily relinquish land for allotment, and in return, they can select Federal land of equal area. Allotments cannot be selected from land within the right-of-way of the TransAlaska Pipeline. Native Corporations can voluntarily relinquish land for allotment and select Federal land of equal area. Allotments cannot be chosen from land within the right-of-way of the TransAlaska Pipeline or certain designated areas. The legislation allows Native Corporations to relinquish land for allotment and select Federal land of equal area, with restrictions on the type of land that can be chosen. The legislation allows Native Corporations to relinquish land for allotment and select Federal land of equal area. An heir of a deceased individual may apply for and receive an allotment on behalf of the estate. Subsections (d) and (e) are redesignated as subsections (f) and (g), and a new subsection (d) is added for the approval of allotments. The Alaska Native Veterans Land Allotment Equity Act requires the Secretary to approve applications for land allotments by December 31, 2020. Notification must be provided to any party with potentially adverse interests in the land within 90 days of receiving an application. The Alaska Native Veterans Land Allotment Equity Act allows for private contests or protests against allotment applications. The Secretary cannot issue a certificate for the allotment until a final determination is made. Reselection of land is permitted after the enactment of the Act. The Veterans Land Allotment Equity Act allows for reselection of land that was selected before the Alaska Native Veterans Land Allotment Equity Act, but not yet conveyed to the person. The Secretary of the Interior must issue final regulations within one year of the Act's enactment to implement the amendments.
